title: How Downs Work
subtitle: The 4-Try System That Drives Every Play

script.hook: Want to know why teams always say '3rd and long'? Ninety seconds — you'll get it.

sections.title: Big Picture
sections.content: A down is one try to move the ball forward. Teams get four downs to go ten yards.

sections.title: 1st Down Explained
sections.content: If it's 1st and 10, the offense has four tries starting now to gain 10 yards. If they make 10 yards before the four tries are up, it's a new set — another 1st down.
sections.onScreen: '1st & 10' badge appears showing yard marker moving 10 yards

sections.title: 2nd & 3rd Down
sections.content: If they don't get 10 on the first try, it becomes 2nd down. If still short, 3rd down — this is often the moment coaches decide: run for short gains or pass for more yardage.
sections.onScreen: 2nd & 5, 3rd & 7 examples with arrows (run vs pass icons)

sections.title: 4th Down Choices
sections.content: On 4th down teams decide: punt (kick it away), try to convert (go for it), or kick a field goal if close enough. That decision depends on the yardage left and the game situation.

sections.title: Reading Tip
sections.content: Quick rule: read down and distance. '3rd & 2' means it's 3rd down and they need 2 yards — expect a short run or quick pass. '4th & 12'? You'll usually see a punt or long play.

sections.title: Mental Model & Recap
sections.content: Simple mental model: you have four tries to move 10 yards. Every play is either trying to gain yards or set up the next down. Recap: four tries to gain ten. Read the down & distance.
sections.onScreen: diagram: '10 yards line → get to it in ≤4 tries' + CTA

questions.question: What does '1st & 10' mean?
options: It's the first quarter and 10 minutes left
The offense has 1st down and needs 10 yards to get a new set
The defense has 1 yard to stop a 10-yard play
The team must score in 10 plays
questions.explanation: Exactly right! '1st & 10' means it's first down and the team needs to gain 10 yards within their 4 attempts to earn a new set of downs.

questions.question: How many attempts does a team get to move the ball 10 yards?
questions.explanation: Teams get exactly 4 downs (attempts) to move the ball 10 yards. If they succeed, they get a new set of 4 downs to move another 10 yards.

questions.question: It's '4th & 3' at your own 20-yard line. What do most teams do?
options: Go for it and try to get the 3 yards
questions.explanation: Most teams punt on 4th down from deep in their own territory. Punting gives the ball to the opponent but pins them far away from scoring position.

questions.question: A team gains 7 yards on 1st down. What's the next down?
questions.explanation: After gaining 7 yards on 1st & 10, it becomes 2nd & 3 (second down, 3 yards to go for a first down). They started needing 10 yards and gained 7, leaving 3 yards.

keyTerms.definition: One of the 4 attempts a team gets to advance the ball 10 yards
When a team successfully moves 10+ yards and gets a new set of 4 downs
Kicking the ball away on 4th down to avoid turning it over
